notes: #description
On 02 November 2019, 9 children were killed and 1 was wounded while they were walking to school as they stepped on a Taliban-planted landmine in the Tahiraha village of Darqad district, Takhar.
As reported on November 2 2019, a number of students of the American University of Beirut, demonstrated outside the University's main entrance, against it's re-opening. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: LGUT: Libyan General Teachers Union; Teachers (Libya)
notes: On 2 November, 2019, teachers of Sabha Teachers Union, continued their sit-in by closing all schools in Sabha City, Sebha, until all their demands are met, including salary raise. [size=no report]
Around Nov 2nd 2019 (exact date not reported), in Ikatelo, a primary school was set on fire allegedly by Dahalo militias. Motives of the attack are unknown. No fatalities reported.

02 November. Unidentified gunmen attacked a gathering of the Oba of Lagos, the chancellor of Edo University and the Edo State Governor at the premises of the former APC Edo State Chairman close to Edo State University (exact location not reported, coded as Iyahmo). Cars were damaged.

On November 2, students continued their demonstrations by staging a sit-in in front of the Universal College of Medical Sciences in Bhairahawa city (Rupandehi district, Lumbini), against the administration for charging higher tuition fees than the government set amount. [size=no report]
On 2 Nov, a score of parents staged a protest in Srinagar city (J&K), against private schools demanding transport charges during the time since the August lockdown began. [size=score]

On 2 November, about 100 parents of children with speech disabilities rallied outside the Episkopi police station in solidarity with a father that had to report to the police because his child was not attending school due to the lack of support staff. [size=about 100]
Arrests: On 1 November, 2019, regime forces manning a checkpoint in Kherbet Ghazala in Dar'a arrested a female university student.
On 1 November 2019, in Ain Jaloulah, residents organized a protest to denounce the delays in the construction of the high school perimeter fence.[size=no report]

01 November 2019. Students demonstrated at the Southern African Nazarene University (SANU), Manzini, protested their allowances not being paid since August. School property has been damaged and forced non-demonstrating students out of classes. One demonstrator has been injured by a non-demonstrating student. [size=no report].
On November 1st, police arrested student demonstrators at Gulu University (Gulu district) who were protesting in solidarity with collegues at Makerere University. [size=70]

On 1 November, students of Port-Mout School held a protest in front of their school in Port Blair city (South Andaman, Andaman and Nicobar) demanding teachers for Hindi and History subjects. [size=no report]

On 1 November, thousands of cooks and their helpers of various government schools of Nagoan district clashed with the police during a demonstration on the Nagaon-Laokhowa road on the outskirts of Nagoan city (Nagaon, Assam) against the Assam government's decision to handover the mid-day meal scheme to a private organisation. [size=thousands]
On 1 Nov, suspected militants burnt down a school at Kumdalan village (Shopian, J&K), a day ahead of board examinations.

On November 1, a group of parents staged a protest in front of a school in Dambulla town (Dambulla, Matale district). The parents were demanding the removal of seven teachers who allegedly encouraged the students to not complain to the police about a school teacher involved in the abduction of two students. [size=no report]

On November 1, the college administration of Universal College of Medical Sciences locked students in a hostel in Bhairahawa city (Rupandehi district, Lumbini), to prevent them from voicing against the college administration for charging higher tuition fees than the government set amount. [size=no report]

On November 1, police beat up the protesting students of Universal College of Medical Sciences in Bhairahawa city (Rupandehi district, Lumbini). The students were demonstrating against the college administration for charging higher tuition fees than the government set amount. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: On Oct 31, pro-Houthi forces reportedly shelled Adhir area in Hayfan district, injuring 2 children on their way back from school.

On 31 October 2019, in Rabat, students at the Economy and Science faculty protested in front of the parliament to denounce the Ministery of education's decision not to grant them access to highly qualified schools. [size=no reports]

assoc_actor_1: IUSF: Inter University Students' Federation; Students (Sri Lanka)
notes: On October 31, Inter University Students' Federation (IUSF) staged a protest in front of the Fort Railway Station in Colombo city (Colombo, Colombo district). The protesters were demanding that authorities reinstate scholarships of students belonging to Ruhuna Students' Federation. [size=no report]

On October 31, students of Universal College of Medical Sciences demonstrated by holding a protest rally and assembly in Bhairahawa city (Rupandehi district, Lumbini), against the administration for charging higher tuition fees than the government set amount. [size=no report]

On Oct 31, more than twenty teachers of Rajshahi University Progressive Teachers' Society formed a human chain on campus (Rajshahi) demanding removal of VC for his alleged involvement in teachers recruitment. The protest entered sixth consecutive day. [size=more than 20]

On October 31, Students Action Committee, Shah Abdul Latif University (SALU), held a protest rally culminating at Khairpur Press Club in Khairpur city (Khairpur, Sindh) against the university administration for failing to address student issues such as scarcity of books in the library, poor drainage system, and shortage of buses. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: YDA: Young Doctors Association; Health Workers (Pakistan)
notes: On October 31, members of YDA Sindh Chapter including YDAs from Dr Ruth Pfau Civil Hospital Karachi (CHK), National Institute of Child Health (NICH), Abbasi Shaheed Hospital (ASH), Sindh Government Lyari General Hospital and others held a march and protested at Jinnah Sindh Medical College in Cantonment town (Karachi, Sindh) against newly formed Pakistan Medical Commission (PMC) and demanded restoration of Pakistan Medical and Dental Council (PMDC). [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: KTOEOS: Cyprus Turkish Secondary School Teachers Union; Teachers (Cyprus)
notes: On 31 October, teachers in Lapithos (Lapta) in Northern Cyprus refused to enter their classrooms to protest against the appointment of a teacher wearing a hijab at school. The chairwoman of KTOEOS said the issue was not about the dress code, but with attempts by Turkey to impose 'political Islam' onto the Turkish Cypriot community. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 31 October, members of the Student Struggle Front and 78 other student associations from all over Greece demonstrated in separate marches in central Athens over education reforms and the abolition of the university asylum law. There were clashes with police outside parliament. Police used tear gas and stun grenades. [size=no report]

On October 30, a booby-trapped car of unknown origin reportedly exploded outside Dhamar University in Dhamar governorate as a graduation ceremony attended by a number of prominent pro-Houthi leaders was taking place, with no report of fatalities nor injuries.

On October 30 2019, about 60 University students gathered at the Middle East University in Amman, to start their 300 km long Climate March which will lead them from Amman, to Madaba, Wadi Al Mujib, Karak, Maan and then to Aqaba. [size=about 60]

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
actor2: Military Forces of Libya (2016-) Government of National Accord
source: Libya24; Al Wasat (Libya); Libya EN; Akhbar Libya
notes: On October 30, LNA reportedly conducted multiple strikes against GNA military targets in Misratah including Misrata Air College, no casualties reported.
On Oct 30th 2019, Embu University Students staged a protest over proposed fees. The road in front of the school was blocked. Police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Burkina Faso); Labour Group (Burkina Faso)
notes: On October 30, health workers and unionists continued observing a sit-in at the University Hospital of Ouahigouya.[size=dozens]
On Oct 30, a teacher and few students of Jahangirnagar university allegedly assaulted protesting students demanding VC's resignation on campus (Savar). [size=few]

On October 30, police fired tear gas and baton charged students of Shaheed Benazir Bhutto University (SBBU) who were protesting on the main Sakrand Road in Nawabshah city (Shaheed Benazirabad, Sindh) against the university administration demanding reduction of hostel fees. At least 17 students were injured in the incident. [size=at least 17]

On Oct 30, students of Rajshahi university staged a protest demonstration on Dhaka-Rajshahi highway (Rajshahi) against the decision of ICC to ban Bangladesh cricket captain on corruption charges. [size=no report]

On 30 October, the North-Eastern Hill University Teachers' Association (NEHUTA) today organized a silent protest in Shillong (East Khasi Hills, Meghalaya) to express their resentment against Vice Chancellor, S.K. Srivastava and his failure to address issues concerning the teaching fraternity of the university. [size=no report]

On October 30, students organizations along with human rights advocates and many students held a protest at University of Balochistan in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan) against the university authorities demanding comprehensive investigations into alleged harassment and blackmailing of students using videos recorded with hidden cameras inside the campus. The protesters also demanded the removal of the Frontier Corps check posts from the university as well as restoration of student unions. [size=many]

On October 30, doctors belonging to the Federation of Government Doctor's Association (FOGDA) staged a protest outside the KAP Viswanatham Government Medical College in Tiruchi city (Tiruchirappalli, TN), demanding increase in salaries among other demands. [size=no report]

On 30 October 2019, numbers of teachers in Krabi province, Thailand, dressed in black to protest against the government's policies on closing down schools, in solidarity with other teacher protesters protesting in Bangkok. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 30 October, about 40 hooded rioters emerged from the university campus and created roadblocks on Patission street, set fire to garbage dumpsters outside the Athens University of Economics and Business, damaged storefronts and scattered fliers to express solidarity with the demonstrators in Chile. MAT riot police responded with tear gas. The group Female Anarchists-Male Anarchists claimed responsibility for the incident. [size=about 40]

On 30 October, students in Lakatamia of Nicosia protested spontaneously by not entering their classrooms over disagreements related to the school uniform regulations and the expulsion of the president of the student council. [size=no report]

On 29 October, 2019, students held their 36th consecutive anti-regime university demonstrations in Annaba. Judges also held a sit-in to denounce corruption and mark the third day of the general strike throughout the country. [size=dozens].
On 29 October, 2019, students held their 36th consecutive anti-regime university demonstrations in Algiers [size=tens of thousands].
On October 29, students at al-Nour College in Bartella, Nineweh province protested against government corruption in solidarity with protests happening all over Iraq. [size=no report]

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: On October 29, suspected JNIM militants aboard motorbikes attacked the market in the village of Garbame, looking for leaders of the village self-defense. The attackers gun shot wounded a man severely who attempted to alert security forces. A school in the locality was also set ablaze.
On October 29th, police fired tear gas against journalists covering protests at Markerere University (Kampala), and arrested three.

On October 29th, students gathered at Markerere University (Kampala), as part of sustained demonstration against a cumulative fee increase. Police fired tear gas against demonstrators. [size=no report]
29 October 2019. Students have been demonstrating at the University of the Western Cape (UWC) in Bellville over grievances with their accommodation in Belhar since last week. [size=no report].
On 29 October, 2019, students held their 36th consecutive anti-regime university demonstrations in Annaba [size=no report].
On 29 October, 2019, students held their 36th consecutive anti-regime university demonstrations in Constantine [size=thousands].
On 29 October, 2019, students held their 36th consecutive anti-regime university demonstrations in Bejaia [size=thousands].

notes: On October 29, health workers and unionists began observing a 72-hour sit-in at the University Hospital of Ouahigouya.[size=dozens]

Around October 29, 2019, students of the Nursing Department of the Grand Gedeh County Community College (GGCCC) protested in Zwedru, demanding that full accreditation be granted to the department. [size=no report]
On 29 October 2019, near Chefchaouen in the Jebha region, high school students and their parents organized a protest to denounce the infected food offered to them at their canteen. [size=dozens]
On October 29, 2019, Students who did not validate their registration for 2017-2018 academic year, protested in the University of Cocody to demand the regularization of their status. [size=tens]

On 29 October 2019, following the death of a motorbike taxi driver by the bodyguard of an FARDC Colonel at the crossing of Kianza and University avenues of Kinshasa, commune of Ngaba, taxi drivers temporarily blocked traffic in the area by burning tyres.
29 October 2019. Students from the M'manga Community Day Secondary School in Balaka demonstrated on the M1 road against the school banning girls from wearing a hijab. [size=no report].
On October 29th, secondary school students protested in Um Rawaba (North Kordofan state), against high registration fees to sit secondary school exams. [size=hundreds]

As reported on October 29, students of Government High School, Killi Nohsaar, protested outside Balochistan Board Office in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan) after their school principal failed to submit registration fee on time and a late fee was issued in order to submit their registration. [size=no report]
On Oct 29, a school boy was beaten by rioting villagers on suspicion of theft at Maldhara village, Sridharpur union (Abhaynagar, Jessore). [size=no report]
On Oct 29, students of Dhaka university staged a protest demonstration outside VC office (Shahbagh, Dhaka city) against the accommodation crisis at the university. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On 29 Oct, suspected militants opened fire on a CRPF mobile bunker stationed at a school examination centre in Drabgam (Pulwama, J&K).

As reported on October 29, a group of teachers from Pitigala - Poddiwela Maha Vidyalaya school staged a protest in front of the school in Elpitiya town (Elpitiya, Galle district). The protesters were dissatisfied with a recent incident in which a former pupil of the school assaulted a teacher. [size=no report]

On October 29, protest was held by family members in Dharmapuri city (Dharmapuri, TN) after a young woman died due to the alleged negligence of doctors at Dharmapuri Government Medical College Hospital. [size=no report]

On October 29, members of Federation of Government Doctors Association protested on the premises of the Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hospital in Salem city (Salem, TN), demanding increase in salaries among other demands. Nearly 90% of doctors and house surgeons took part in the protest. [size=nearly 90%]

On October 29, about 80 students of the Technical faculty under the Vavuniya campus of Jaffna University protested by blocking the campus chief's office on Park street in Vavuniya city (Vavuniya South, Vavuniya district). The students were demanding greater safety as they were unable to continue their education due to the outbreak of infections in the campus and hostel. [size=about 80]

On 29 October 2019, more than 200 school teachers dressed in black gathered in front of the parliament in kwaeng Thanon Nakhon Chai Si, Dusit district of Bangkok, Thailand, in protest against the Draft National Education Act. [size=more than 200]

On Oct 29, 2019, dozens of people held a peaceful protest in front of a court in Somba Opu district, Gowa regency, South Sulawesi province, regarding a murder case of a female student by a university lecturer. The protesters were students and the victim's family. [size=dozens]

On Oct 28, residents of Saladin camp in al Bureiqah district in Aden governorate protested the actions of the department of education in the district in regards to the rotation of school principals, which has affected the quality of education at these schools. [size=no report]
On October 28, riot police dispersed student protests at Tigris University in Baghdad with sound bombs.
On October 28, riot police dispersed student protests at al-Farahidi University in Baghdad with sound bombs.

On October 28 2019, Lebanese citizens continued to demonstrate across Lebanon for a twelfth day and demanded the government to resign. Lebanese students of the American University of Beirut, demonstrated by sitting in the middle of the seafront boulevard in Ain el-Mreisse. [size=no report]
On October 28, students at Mosul University held a protest in solidarity with protesters elsewhere in the country. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On October 28 2019, Israeli forces demolished a wall of a Palestinian school in the village of Thaher al Maleh west of Jenin and seized a container which was used as a school cafeteria. Israeli forces stormed the village and declared the school a closed military zone.

On 28 October 2019, students from two different schools in Bukavu reportedly protested in front of the governor's cabinet to ask authorities to pay their teachers so that the latter could resume their work after a week-long strike. [size=no report]
28 October 2019. Students have been demonstrating at the University of the Western Cape (UWC) in Bellville over grievances with their accommodation in Belhar. [size=no report].

notes: On October 28, health workers and unionists began observing a 72-hour sit-in at the University Hospital of Ouahigouya.[size=dozens]

28 October 2019. Riots have been reported at the Lunzu Secondary School in Blantyre. Students have damaged various structures at the school, houses belonging to teachers, and one student has been injured. [size=no report].

28 October 2019. Students, led by Musrec and staff demonstrated at the Mzuzu University to demanda that management address fee balances that block students from writing exams, and teachers are demanding their allowances. Police fired teargas to disperse the crowds. [size=no report].

On October 28, 2019, students of the University of Liberia, demonstrated in Fendell Campus, rejecting the newly appointed President of the University, Dr. Sarwolo Nelson. They forced their colleagues to abandon classes and disrupted normal campus activities. [size=no report]

On October 28, 2019, students of the University of Liberia, demonstrated in Capitol Hill Campus, Monrovia, rejecting the newly appointed President of the University, Dr. Sarwolo Nelson. They forced their colleagues to abandon classes and disrupted normal campus activities. [size=no report]
On Oct 28, over 300 students of Viqarunnisa Noon School and College formed a human chain on campus (Dhaka city) to raise awareness on climate change. [size=over 300]

On Oct 28, teachers and students of Bhatera school and college staged a protest outside campus (Kulaura, Maulvibazar) demanding punishment of the rapists of a seventh grader girl of the institution. [size=no report]

On Oct 28, students of Pabna University of Science and Technology staged a protest demonstration on campus (Pabna) demanding withdrawal of show-cause notices served to three teachers along with other demands. [size=no report]

On Oct 28, 2019, hundreds of elementary school students held a peaceful protest in front of their school in Karang Bahagia district, Bekasi regency, West Java province. Their school was closed due to a land dispute. They demanded their rights to receive an education. [size=hundreds]

On Oct 28, 2019, dozens of parents of students held a peaceful protest in front of a school in Alla district, Enrekang Regency, South Sulawesi province, regarding an allegation of sexual harassment at the school by a teacher. [size=dozens]

On Oct 28, 2019, two groups of students, from art and language faculties, engaged in a riot in front of their university in Makassar city, South Sulawesi province, during a demonstration to commemorate Youth Pledge Day. They threw rocks at each other. A week earlier, a group of art students stabbed two language students, triggered by personal fights. The violence during the riot was allegedly an act of revenge. [size=no report]

On October 27, Saudi rocket and artillery shelling was reported on populated villages of Razih border district in northwestern Yemen, Sadah governorate, with no report of fatalities nor injuries but allegedly killing livestocks and damaging a school.

On 27 October 2019, regime forces shelled Janudiyeh and its vicinity in Idleb, killing a child. The child was displaced from Jabal al-Akrad. Several shells targeted the town's Girls High school, partially destroying the school's building and lightly damaging its furniture.
On October 27, students at al-Mustnasiriya University in the Rusafa area of Baghdad protested on campus against government corruption. [size=no report]
On October 27, dozens of students of Diyala University protested on campus near al-Bawiyah in Diyala province against government corruption and inadequate employment opportunities. [size=dozens]

Assumed on October 27, the college administration under the leadership of Director of Birgunj National Medical College locked more than 80 protesting students in a hostel in Birgunj city (Parsa district, Narayani), after the students voiced against the college administration charging higher tuition fees than the government set amount. [size=more than 80]

On October 27, organized by National Events Organizing Committee Mirpur district, members of civil society, private and public organizations, members of social and political parties, journalists organizations, faculty members and students of MUST University, local schools and colleges participated in a rally in New Mirpur city (Mirpur, Azad Jammu and Kashmir) to express solidarity with Kashmiris of Indian Administered J&K and observe a "Black Day" to condemn the commencement of Indian administration in Kashmir 72 years ago. On October 27, female students of Islamia University of Bahawalpur (IUB) held a rally in Bahawalpur city (Bahawalpur, Punjab) to express solidarity with Kashmiris of Indian Administered J&K and observe a "Black Day" to condemn the commencement of Indian administration in Kashmir 72 years ago. On October 27, about 200 people took part in a protest organized by Yabloko in Saint Petersburg against the plans to move the main campus of Saint Petersburg State University away from the downtown core area. [size=about 200]

On 27 October, several housing activists marched from the University Square to the Izvor Park in Bucharest, demanding a ban on forced evacuation and a facilitation of access to the social housing system. [size=several]
26 October 2019. The ACDP marched in Tshwane (Pretoria), demanding government to stop their plans of introducing sex education at schools. [size=100].

25 October 2019. MEC commissioners were blocked and stoned during a campaign. 13 houses have been set alight and people sustained injuries. The violence was sparked by the DPP allegedly buying votes through registering voters for loans Ndaula Primary School. A chairman was beaten up by bystanders. 16 people have been arrested. Parliamentary by-election campaign in Lilongwe South Constituency has been postponed due to violence and vote buying.

On 04 April, 2019, regime forces shelled Sehriyeh in northern Hama countryside using rocket fire, impacting near a school and partially damaging its building and furniture. Neither fatalities nor injuries were reported.

On 04 April, 2019, regime and loyal militia forces shelled the market area in Kafr Nobol in southern Idleb countryside using rocket fire. The shelling impacted in close proximity to a first aid dispensary and an emergency system center, damaging their buildings and equipment and to a school, partially damaging its building and furniture. The shelling also impacted a local bakery. 13 civilians including 3 children and 2 women were killed and 27 others were wounded.

On 5 Mar, in Hyderabad (Hyderabad, Telangana), Osmania University (OU) students staged a protest in front of the BC Study Circle condemning the delays in giving scholarships, study materials, and books to the students selected for training. [size=no report]

On 05 March, road and rail traffic was disrupted in Bihar state with the exception of Patna city during the Bharat bandh called by some social organisations to protest against University Grant Commission's 13-point roster system for appointment of teachers in colleges and universities, Centre's Citizenship (Amendment) Bill and 10% reservation for economically weaker sections. [size=no report]

On 05 March, road and rail traffic was disrupted in Bihar state including Vaishali district (Bihar) during the Bharat bandh called by some social organisations to protest against University Grant Commission's 13-point roster system for appointment of teachers in colleges and universities, Centre's Citizenship (Amendment) Bill and 10% reservation for economically weaker sections. [size=no report]

On 05 March, parents of Global Indian International School staged a protest outside the school located at Gota, Ahmedabad city (Gujarat) for violating the order of the Fee Regulatory Committee (FRC). [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 05 March, members of Akhil Bhartiya Vidyarthi Parishad held a protest in Ranchi city (Jharkhand) against a missionary institution Ursuline Intermediate College for sending students in Rahul Gandhi's rally. [size=25]

On March 5, members of the Rajiv Gandhi University Students' Union (RGUSU), RGU Research Scholars' Forum (RGURSF) and RGU Teachers' Association (RGUTA) staged a protest and campus shutdown in Rono city (Papum Pare, Arunachal Pradesh), in support of a Bharat Bandh called by several tribal outfits against University Grants Commission's new 13-point system that will cut jobs for SCs, STs, and the OBCs. [size=no report]

On 5 Mar, local residents, including students, staged a protest in Turtuk town (J&K), demanding the reinstatement of an earlier decision to establish a government degree college in the area. [size=massive]

05 March. An unidentified armed group attacks the Cameroon College of Arts and Sciences in Kumba of Ekondo Titi. Staff and students are required to leave the campus but no reports of civilian casualties.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 March 2019. Police and soldiers shot and killed a man in Cibanda, Mwenga (coordinates for Cibanda school used prec1), after he resisted arrest. The security forces injured five other youth.

Lumad protesters and groups like Save Our Schools Mindanao and Kasalo-CARAGA marched to various government offices Manila, Metro Manila on March 5, 2019. They were protesting the Supreme Court's decision to extend martial law throughout Mindanao as well as the supposed intervention of the United States in Philippine affairs. [size= no report]
On 04 March, 2019, students in Bouira protested against Bouteflika's bid for a fifth term on the Akli Mouhand Oulhadj University [size=hundreds].

On March 4, in Marcory, a group of students and people armed with machetes prevented some Isfop and Loko students from accessing their schools. Some were reportedly beaten and their phones stolen. [size=no report]

On March 4, in Bouake, in the morning students blocked the international road linking Bouake to Abidjan, protesting against the ongoing strike in the education sector, that has led to an interruption of most public schools. [size=no report]

On March 4, in Koumassi, a group of highschool students, helped with other young people from the area, forced Bad middleschool students and Modern Highschool students to leave their classes, throwing rocks at them. Rioters protested against the national strike in the public education sector which has led to an interruption of most public schools. Police Forces interfered to disperse them. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: SASCO: South Africa Students Congress; Students (South Africa)
notes: 04 March. Students at the Stellenbosch University, led by SASCO, held a demonstration to pressure university management to scrap a proposed ZAR9 bus fare increase. [size=no report].

04 March. Students, led by the Student Representative Council, from the University of South Africa's Durban campus marched in protest over National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) allowances and the postponement of examinations. [size=100].

04 March. Students protested at the Tshwane University of Technology (TUT) in protest against NSFAS-funded meal allowances for off-campus students. Tyres were set alight. Police used stun grenades to disperse the students [size=no report].
04 March. Students from the University of Mpumalanga blocked the entrances of the campus with burning tyres in protest over the increase of off-campus accommodation. [size=no report].

On March 4th, students staged a sit-in protest at the National University in Khartoum, whilst eployees of the NewTech firm also demonstrated. Both demonstrations were against the government, amidst nationwide protests. [size=no report]

On 4 March 2019, a number of teachers and parents of students at a private elementary school in Sidi Bouzid held a protest in front of the school premises to denounce the entrance of the security forces in the school and the arrest of its director. [size=several]

On March 4th, students burnt down parts of a school at an unspecified location in Koro sub-district (Omoro district), in protest at the removal of three staff members, and inadequate rations. Seven students were subsequently arrested.

On March 4 2019, clashes broke out between Palestinians and Israeli forces near Al-Quds University in Abu Dis town. Palestinians threw stones at Israeli soldiers. No injuries were reported. [size=no report]
On Mar 4, students of Jahangirnagar University (Savar, Dhaka) besieged the central library and staged a sit-in protesting against authorities' decision to not allow bags in library. [size=300]

On Mar 4, students of Sheikh Hasina Medical College in Jamalpur town (Mymensingh), formed a human chain on the college campus, boycotting their classes for the third consecutive day demanding arrest and punishment of two local youths who assaulted two students of the college earlier. [size=no report]

On 04 March, teachers of 104 unaided Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) schools protested outside Matoshree, the residence of Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray in Mumbai city (Maharashtra). The protestors are demanding the civic body should provide financial aid to these schools. [size=no report]
On 4 Mar, locals staged a protest at Ramgarh town (Samba, J&K) against the district administration over the decision to build a government degree college in a different location. [size=large number]

On 4 Mar, locals staged a protest at Marheen town (Kathua, J&K) over the government's decision to lay the foundation stone for a degree college serving the area in a village 10km from Marheen town. [size=no report]

On March 4, retired officers and staffs of Sindh Agriculture University Tando Jam staged a protest and a sit-in outside the vice chancellor's office in Tando Jam town (Hyderabad, Sindh), against the university administration demanding payment of their outstanding pensions and other dues. [size=no report]

On March 4, under the leadership of Sindh Student's Council (SSC), students from Mehran University, Sindh University, Liaqat University of Medical and Health Sciences (LUMHS) and Sindh Agriculture University Tando Jam held a rally and staged a protest outside Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh), demanding restoration of student unions. [size=large]

On March 4, students and teachers of Government Girls Degree College Larkana held a rally culminating at a press club in Jinnah Bagh, Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh), to express solidarity with Pakistan Army. [size=no report]

On March 3rd, demonstrations took place in Greater Khartoum (coded as three events in Khartoum, Khartoum North and Omdurman) as part of nationwide anti-govt protests. A sit-in was also staged at an unspecified university [size=no report]

On March 3 2019, a group of 11th graders held a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Education against the newly imposed single-semester system for tawjihi (Senior-Highschool) students. [size=no report]

On March 3 2019, hundreds of students demonstrated in different locations throughout the Karak province against the newly imposed single-semester system for tawjihi (Senior-Highschool) students. [size=hundreds]

On March 3, a group of students from Istanbul University staged a protest to commemorate a murdered student by gathering in Beyazit Campus of the university in Fatih, Istanbul. Police forces intervened and detained 17 students. [size=no report]
On Mar 3, officials of Islamic University staged a protest demonstration at campus in Kushtia, Khulna, demanding increase in salary and retirement age for the officials. [size=300]

On March 3, a clash took place between old boys of St. Peter's College and St. Joseph's College on the final day of their annual big match at the P Sara Oval in Colombo city. At least four spectators were injured. In the commotion a fire cracker exploded among the crowd. [size=no report]
On 3 Mar, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), government college teachers staged a hunger strike demanding annulment of transfer orders of teachers who participated in the JACTTO-GEO protests. [size=400]

On March 2, Government Medical College employees boycotted work and held a demonstration rally in Amritsar (Punjab) to demand the regularisation of work for contract employees. [no size=no report]

On March 2, guest teachers of Delhi government schools continued demonstrating outside the residence of the Education Minister in Delhi-New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) for a second day, demanding regularisation. [size=no report]

On 2 Mar, residents of Watrihal in Budgam district staged a protest at the Press Enclave in Srinagar city (J&K), demanding the establishment of a government degree college in their area. [size=scores]

On 2 Mar, demonstrators diverted traffic on the Srinagar-Charar-e-Sharief road at Chadoora village (Budgam, J&K), amid a shutdown, demanding the establishment of a government degree college in their area. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 2 Mar, in Vijayapura (Vijayapura, Karnataka), the ABVP activists staged a protest at the BLDE Engineering College premises against a professor who made anti-national remarks on social media (Facebook) in relation to the Pulwama attack in J&K. The professor apologized and students made him kneel and plead forgiveness. [size=no report]

On March 2, students from different schools, leaders of District Bar Association and members of different organizations held a rally culminating at a local press club in Mehrabpur town (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh), to express support for the Pakistan Army. [size=no report]
01 March: Bungoma High school students protested against school principal. [size=no report]
On Mar 1, at least three activist of BCL were injured in infighting at Rajshahi university in Rajshahi city over a cricket match. [size=no report]

On March 1, guest teachers of Delhi government schools demonstrated outside the residence of the Education Minister in Delhi-New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) demanding regularisation. The day before, their contract ended and they were not informed if it would be terminated or renewed. [size=no report]

On March 1, over 100 students of Sridev Suman Subharti Medical College demonstrated on the street outside Doon Medical College in Dehradun (Uttarakhand) to oppose the government's decision for them to re-sit their first-year exam. [size= 100]

On March 1, a group of villagers, students and parents staged a protest in front of Government Secondary School in Namunaghar village (South Andaman, Andaman and Nicobar), demanding immediate repairing of school building and also provision of a proper playground. [size=dozens]

On March 1, students continued demonstrating for the third day at the University of Health Sciences in Rohtak (Haryana) and burnt the effigy of the VC to demand hostel facilities and increased stipends. Some students were reportedly dragged and beaten by police and others were detained and later released. [size=no report]
On March 1, students and teachers of the Government Sachal Sarmast Degree College staged a rally in Ranipur town (Khairpur, Sindh), to express support for the Pakistan Armed Forces. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Students (South Africa); EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters
notes: 01 March. Protest action, led by the EFFSC, have been reported at the University of the Free State (UFS). Rubbish have been thrown out of the bins during the protest [size=no report].

assoc_actor_1: MSF: Muslim Students Federation; SFI: Students Federation of India; Muslim Group (India); Students (India); Journalists (India); Civilians (India)
notes: On 1 Mar, in Malappuram district (Kerala), MSF activists in Calicut University staged a demonstration against the alleged sidelining of the their members in the ongoing C Zone youth festival. Several (7 police, students, and 3 journalists) were injured in stone-pelting and clashes with the SFI and were admitted to a hospital. MSF were later arrested. [size=no report]
On February 28, university teachers across Niger began observing a 72-hour strike, demanding improved living and working conditions.

28 February. Outsourced workers along with the Workers and Students Forum, disrupted classes at the University of the Free State. The protesters demanded that all jobs should be in-sourced. [Size=no report].

On 28 February 2019, a number of teachers held a protest at the headquarters of the Regional Directorate for Education in Gafsa to voice their demands including the criminalization of violence against teachers and improvement in the status of public schools. [size=no report]

On 28 February 2019, teachers held a protest at the headquarters of the Regional Directorate for Education in El Kef against the procrastination in responding to their demands as well as the deterioration of school infrastructure. [size=no report]
On 28 Feruary 2019, teachers and staff at a primary school in Mateur held a protest to demand an improvement in their working conditions. [size=no report]

28-29 February. Students from the University of KwaZulu-Natal blocked Hospital Road, Durban, by burning mattresses and various other items including a fridge. The protest was in response to living conditions at university residences. Police was called onto the scene to disperse the protesting students. [size=no report].

On February 28, students from Istanbul University staged a protest in front of Istanbu courthouse in Sisli, Istanbul for their lecturers sentenced to prison due to having signed the declaration reacting military operations in southeastern Turkey. CHP supported the protest. [size=several dozens]

On Feb 28, at least three activists of BCL were injuring during a clash between two rioting factions of BCL over the annual sports games at Government Haji Mohammad Mohsin College in Chittagong town. Police brought the situation under control. [size=no report]

On February 28, several student bodies demonstrated on campus of the Kurukshetra University at Thanesar (Kurukshetra, Harayan) to demand a meeting with the VC. Some students who tried to forcefully enter the VC office were removed and 44 of them detained by police. [size=no report]

On 28 Feb, in Coimbatore city (Coimbatore, TN), members of the Coimbatore Diocese of the Church of South India (CSI) assaulted one another with iron rods and wooden logs over the appointment of principal to the CSI Boys' Higher Secondary School, injuring a Pastor and Diocese's education wing convener. [size=no report]

Assumed on 28 Feb, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), a group of students from the School of Excellence in Law (SOEL) clashed after a heated argument erupted during a bid to settle a feud that had emerged a few months ago. No further information was provided. [size=no report]

On 28 Feb, students staged a protest at the Government Medical College (GMC) in Srinagar city (J&K) against earlier mob violence targeting Kashmiri and Muslim students at the Government Medical College (GMC) Jammu hostel. [size=scores]

assoc_actor_1: NSUI: National Students' Union of India; Students (India)
notes: On February 28, 10 members of the Congress' student wing NSUI staged a protest in ITI College in Agartala city (West Tripura, Tripura), demanding the suspension of an instructor. They also complained about the condition of classrooms and irregularities in classes. [size=10]

On 28 Feb, in Tondiarpet village (Chennai, TN), parents of private school students staged a road roko ("obstruct the road") near their school alleging that the school management had made false promises regarding its CBSE affiliation. The police detained a few parents. [size=no report]
On February 28, unidentified armed men shot dead a government primary school teacher near the district headquarters hospital in Karak town (Karak, KP).

On February 28, police personnel dispersed local villagers who blocked a road and attempted to torch a bus during a demonstration near Hattar Industrial Estate in Haripur city (Haripur, KP), against the death of a schoolboy after falling from a bus. [size=no report]

On February 28, students of Government Girls College Ayub Colony staged a rally in Faisalabad city (Faisalabad, Punjab), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=no report]

On February 28, students of the Peshawar University, local traders and minority community held various rallies in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=hundreds]

On February 28, students, teachers, activists of various political parties and civil society participated in a rally held by Federal Urdu University of Arts, Science and Technology (FUUAST) in Karachi city (Karachi, Sindh), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=large]

On February 28, teachers and students of Government Degree College Naseerabad held a rally culminating at a local press club in Naseerabad town (Nasirabad, Balochistan), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=no report]

On February 28, students, faculty and staffs of Shah Abdul Latif University along with representatives of SALUTA staged a rally in Khairpur city (Khairpur, Sindh), to express solidarity with the Pakistani armed forces. [size=no report]

On February 28, Punjab University students, teachers and officials staged a rally in Iqbal town (Lahore, Punjab), to express solidarity with the Pakistani army and condemn Indian aggression. [size=no report]
On 28 February, over 50 contractual clerks began demonstrating on the campus of the Punjabi University in Patiala (Punjab) to demand promotion to 'ad-hoc employees'. [size=over 50]

assoc_actor_1: MSF: Muslim Students Federation; IUML: Indian Union Muslim League; Muslim Group (India); Students (India)
notes: On 28 Feb, near Malappuram district (Kerala), the MSF and the Muslim League staged a protest against the Vice Chancellor of Calicut University at the Senate, alleging sidelining of the their members in the ongoing C Zone youth festival. [size=no report]

On 28 February 2019, a group of people, including a sociology professor at the State University of Jakarta, staged a demonstration in Jakarta against unresolved cases of rights abuses and plans to give jobless generals roles in the civilian bureaucracy. This included the professor singing a protest song from the 1998 student-led movement against former dictator Suharto, which was uploaded online. He was later arrested on 6 March 2019 and was being investigated for hate speech. [size=no report]
28 February 2019. The Raia Mutomboki Musumbu set a primary school office on fire in Lusenge, Shabunda.

On February 28, around 200 aspiring school teachers who passed the School Service Commission (SSC) started an indefinite dharna on Mayo Road in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal), demanding the filling of vacant teaching posts. [size=200]

25-28 February. Students of Antananarivo University Polytechnic School riot over poor living conditions by blocking RN1, burning tires and making stone blockades outside of the university gate in Vontovorona area of Antananarivo. Gendarmerie fire tear gas, with reports of security forces using rubber bullets and arresting students with some injuries reported to journalists and students. [size=no report]

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 28 February. An Imbonerakure militia member stabbed a school administrator who caught him stealing in Kirundo. The population attempted to catch the attacker but his brother, who is also an Imbonerakure member, helped him escape.

On 27 February 2019, teachers held a protest in front of the headquarters of the Regional Directorate of Education in Bizerte against procrastination in responding to their demands regarding professional regulations and the deteriorating conditions of infrastructure in public schools. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: On Feb 27th, protesters (including students) demonstrated in Khartoum as part of nationwide anti-govt protests. Security forces (described as police and "the security apparatus", coded here as police and NISS) surrounded universities, and prevented students from leaving. Tear gas was also fired into two university campuses in Khartoum. [size=no report]

Academic administrators who had been hired but not assigned to posts gathered in front of the University of Aden, calling for a number of demands to be met. This is day 2 of 2 days of protests. [size=no report]

On 27 Feb, two employees of Ranchi University assaulted two journalists who went to the campus in Ranchi city (Jharkhand) to cover students' unrest over regular delays in opening the examination department counter.

On February 27, over 500 sweepers, ward attendants and security guards demonstrated outside the Government Medical College and Hospital in Chandigarh city after it was alleged that a new contractor would fire security guards and bring his own security. [size=500]

On February 27, members of staff at the Gian Sagar Medical College and Hospital held a demonstration outside the premises in Patiala (Punjab) to demand the payment of salaries and EPF owed. [size=no report]

On February 27, students of Punjab Agricultural University in Ludhiana (Punjab) continued their demonstration for the 8th day and blocked gates and prevented access to the administrative block. Students pressed for their voices to be heard on a range of issues. [size=no report]

On 27 Feb, in Hanamkonda tehsil (Warangal, Telangana), activists of various student unions protested outside the college at Naimnagar, demanding stringent action against the culprit who set a girl on fire after she refused his love proposal. [size=no report]

On 27 Feb, near Madurai city (Madurai, TN), villagers and students of the Government Higher Secondary School at Thazhakkudi staged a protest and detained a TN State Transport Corporation bus condemning the headmistress' actions. The latter scolded a girl and referred to her caste when the girl went to her to report on boys who were teasing her. [size=no report]

Assumed on 27 Feb, in Warangal city (Warangal, Telangana), students' organisations and parents of a local college student who attempted suicide after she was caught cheating on her exams staged a protest demanding justice for the girl. Police were present at the scene but there was no report on physical contact. [size=no report]

On 27 Feb, in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Telangana), teachers of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas (KGBVs) and urban residential schools (URSs), including United Teachers Federation (UTF), staged a dharna near Indira Park, demanding increase in salary and better welfare benefits. [size=2000]

On February 27, members of PPP-SB staged a protest in Khairpur city (assumed based on source text) (Khairpur, Sindh), against the police for alleged assault on peaceful protesters outside the Shah Abdul Latif University Khairpur. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Students (Pakistan); Health Workers (Pakistan); YDA: Young Doctors Association
notes: On February 27, students of Nishtar Medical University led by Young Doctors Associations (Reformers) president staged a protest while, foreign students of the university also protested in Multan city (Multan, Punjab), against alleged anti-student policies of the varsity administration and also disconnecting their internet connections respectively. [size=no report]

25-28 February. Students of Antananarivo University Polytechnic School riot over poor living conditions by blocking RN1, burning tires and making stone blockades outside of the university gate in Vontovorona area of Antananarivo. Gendarmerie fire tear gas, with reports of security forces using rubber bullets and arresting students with some injuries reported to journalists and students. [size=no report]
On 26 February, 2019, students at UMMTO (University of Mouloud Mammeri in Tizi Ouzou) gathered in the streets to protest against the regime and Bouteflika's bid for a fifth term. [size=thousands]

On 26 February, 2019, students at the University of Algiers gathered in demonstration against Bouteflika's bid for a fifth term chanting slogans such as "no to a fifth term" and "Bouteflika get out." Police forces intervened with tear gas bombs. [size=thousands]

assoc_actor_1: Students (Ivory Coast); FESCI: Student Federation of Ivory Coast
source: Agence de Presse Africaine; Soir Info; Ivoire Soir
notes: On Feb 26, around 3,000 FESCI students marched in Cocody to demand the restart of classes, following an ongoing national strike in the public sector which has led to an interruption of school. Protesters allegedly damaged several SOTRA buses and beat up a SOTRA worker (FESCI's leaderdenied this allegation). [size=3000]

source: Human Rights Activists News Agency; Azad News Agency
notes: On 26/2/2016, students at 3 male dormitories and a female dormitory of Sanati Sharif University in Tehran staged a protest to demand better transportation survives and improved security standards. [size=large]
On Feb 26, tens of graduates from oil engineering colleges in central Iraq, protested demanding jobs in front of the Ministry of Oil. [size=tens]

On Feb 26 2019, hundreds of students demonstrated in front of the Ministry of Education in Karak city, against the newly imposed single-semester system for tawjihi (Senior-Highschool) students for a second day. [size=hundreds]

On Feb 26 2019, dozens of students demonstrated in front of the Ministry of Education in the city of Maan, against the newly imposed single-semester system for tawjihi (Senior-Highschool) students. [size=dozens]

Academic administrators who had been hired but not assigned to posts gathered in front of the University of Aden, calling for a number of demands to be met. This is day 1 of 2 days of protests. [size=no report]
On Feb 26, a group of teachers of Jahangirnagar university staged a protest demonstration outside VC's office demanding Dean elections in Savar, Dhaka. [size=no report]
On February 26, two persons were injured when supporters of a teacher and a student clashed outside a school in Gag Kalan (Ludhiana, Punjab). [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Kashmiri Communal Group (India); Muslim Group (India); Students (India)
notes: On 26 Feb, a mob with sticks and iron rods raided the Government Medical College hostel in Jammu city (J&K) and smashed windows as they attempted to reach Muslim and Kashmiri students who had barricaded themselves inside. No injuries were reported. [size=no report]

On February 26, as part of an ongoing demonstration, students from the Punjab Agricultural University held a march holding placards in Ludhiana (Punjab) to demand that the rules governing four-wheeler entry on campus be applied to everyone or none at all. [size=no report]
On February 26, students of Delhi University held a demonstration march in New Delhi (NCT of Delhi) to demand that action be taken against a student who assaulted a member of staff. [size=no report]

On 26 Feb, in Tirunelveli district (TN), villagers and various Dalit outfit members staged a sit-in dharna at Marudham Nagar demanding the arrest of those who hacked to death a polytechnic college student from Marudham Nagar in Keezha Munneerpallam. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: AUT: Association of University Teachers; Teachers (India)

On February 26, parents and students organised a sit in demonstration in front of the school gates of Government Ideal Blind School and Government Deaf and Mute School, in Takyelpat area in Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur), demanding upgrading of the schools to class XII standards and to fill up the vacant posts of the schools. [size=no report]

On 13 Feb, local youths pelted policemen with stones at Narbal village (Pulwama, J&K) as the attempted to reach the site of an explosion at Falai-e-Millat school. Police responded with tear gas.

Assumed on 13 Feb, in Bhimavaram town (West Godavari, AP), students and people's organisations staged demonstration in the town to condemn the rape of a 10-year-old school girl of Sri Bharathi School. Day 1

On 13 Feb, on the outskirts of Coimbatore city (Coimbatore, TN), students of Sree Narayana Guru College staged a protest on the campus demanding action against an assistant professor who allegedly harassed two girls.
On 13 Feb, students staged a protest at Kashmir University in Srinagar city (J&K) against the decision by staff to strike in support of a JRL shutdown against moves to abrogate Article 35A.
On 13 Feb, students at MR College in Fazilka (Punjab) staged a protest against the fee demanded by the college management from the Scheduled Caste students.

On 13 Feb, members of the Punjab Students' Union (PSU) staged a protest outside Government Rajindra College in Bathinda town (Punjab). They were protesting the cane-charge on protesting teachers in Patiala.

On 13 Feb, Aligarh Muslim University students boycotted classes and staged a protest at the Bab-eSyed Gate of the university in Aligarh (UP) to raise their voice against sedition charges against 14 accused.

On February 13, students and teachers from the North Eastern Hill University took out a protest march on the premises in Shillong city (East Khasi Hills, Meghalaya), against the Citizenship Amendment Bill.

On February 13, students of Federal Urdu University of Science and Technology staged a protest in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory), against university's management for increasing fees.
On February 13, few locals assaulted teachers of a secondary school in Ishworpur Municipality (Sarlahi district, Janakpur).

On 13 February, 2019, students of Ilia State University launched a protest in Tbilisi demanding that the dean of Business School Giorgi Kadagidze is reinstated to his position and the reform of business school is suspended. [size=no report]

On Feb 12, in Bonon, a group of students protested against professors' strike, which has been interrupting public school for three weeks. Students set up barricades on the main road. Police Forces clashed with the protesters, and used tear gas. Students reportedly threw stones at them. One police officer was injured.
12 February. Learners from Nooitgedacht Primary School, Cape Town, protested against gang violence in the area. The protest was organised by Bishop Lavis Action Community (BLAC).

12 February. Ehlanzeni Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) College students marched to protest the exclusion of students from the National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) funding.
12 February. Students from Cape Peninsula University of Technology, Bellville campus, built shacks on the campus and set fire to buses in protest against accommodation shortages.

On Feb 12 2019, Israeli forces raided the town of Abu Dis in Al Quds and sealed off roads near Al-Quds University. This triggered clashes with Palestinian youth, to which Israeli forces responded by firing rubber bullets and teargas canisters. At least 17 Palestinians were treated from tear gas inhalation.

On Feb 12 2019, 17 Palestinian students suffered from tear-gas inhalation after Israeli forces stormed the Al-Quds University in Abu Dis while classes were ongoing. Israeli forces also fired stun grenades at the students.
On Feb 12 2019, Israeli forces detained and assaulted two Palestinian students on their way to school in Jabal al Tawil in Ramallah.

On 12 Feb, BJP members were assaulted by Aligarh Muslim University students in Aligarh (UP) when they were demanding cancellation of a proposed visit of MIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi to the campus. Report indicates the students were from the Muslim community.

notes: On 12 Feb, ABVP activists who were staging a protest against the visit of MP Asaduddin Owaisi at Aligarh Muslim University in Aligarh (UP) beat a camera crew who were shooting the protest.

On 12 Feb, students staged a protest at the government degree college in R.S. Pura town (Jammu, J&K) against stranded Kashmir-bound passengers who allegedly raised anti-India slogans and police who intervened against rival rioting students.

On 12 Feb, students staged a protest at the government degree college in Samba district town (J&K) against stranded Kashmir-bound passengers who allegedly raised anti-India slogans and police who intervened against rival rioting students.

On 12 Feb, students staged a protest at the government degree college in Kathua district town (J&K) against stranded Kashmir-bound passengers who allegedly raised anti-India slogans and police who intervened against rival rioting students.

On 12 Feb, students staged a protest at the government degree college in Reasi district town (J&K) against stranded Kashmir-bound passengers who allegedly raised anti-India slogans and police who intervened against rival rioting students.

assoc_actor_1: Students (India); ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; JJSF: Jammu Justice Secular Forum
notes: On 12 Feb, ABVP and JJSF led student protests at various college campuses in Jammu city (J&K) against stranded Kashmir-bound passengers who allegedly raised anti-India slogans and police who intervened against rival rioting students.

On 12 Feb, teachers and students protested and raised slogans on campus in New Delhi against the Jawaharlal Nehru University's academic council for adopting a government notification on reservation for economically weaker sections.

On February 12, students of the Postgraduate College, Samanabad, staged a protest at Samanabad Road in Faisalabad city (Faisalabad, Punjab), against kite flying and demanded stern action against those involved in kite manufacturing and flying.

As reported on February 12, students and teachers of a school in Aroop area staged a protest in front of Deputy Commissioner's office in Gujranwala city (Gujranwala, Punjab), against WASA authorities over poor sewerage condition in front of their school.

On February 12, a group assaulted a student with khukuri at the gate of his school in Tulsipur city (Dang district, Rapti). The student sustained serious injuries as a result of the incident and is currently undergoing treatment.

On February 11, dozens of students protested in front of the rectorate of N'Djamena university, the police fired warning shots to prevent the students from entering, and also arrested around ten students.

On Feb 11, in Guiglo, a group of students protested against professors' strike, which has been interrupting public school for three weeks. Students set up barricades and destroyed several statues. Police Forces interfered, using tear gas. One student was injured.

On Feb 11, in Botro, a group of highschool students protesting against the interruption of public school following professors' strike tried to interrupt courses in the Mayor's private school and to force students to leave their classrooms. Police forces clashed with the students and allegedly beat one of them and arrested 11.

On Feb 11, in the morning, public school students (Nangui Abrogoua highschool, Williamsville highschool, and Harris highschool) attempted to interrupt courses in Djedji Amondji Pierre highschool, throwing stones, bottles and sticks at the students, injuring 3 of them and forcing them to leave their classrooms. They were protesting against the interruption of public school following professors' strike since three weeks. Police Forces interfered, using tear gas to disperse the rioters.

On Feb 11, a group of students, protesting against the interruption of public school following a professors' strike, attempted to interrupt courses and force students of Nangui Abrogoua highschool to leave their classrooms, in Abidjan.

On Feb 11, Alepe Modern highschool students protested against the interruption of public school following an ongoing professors' strike. They threw stones at students from other schools, forcing them to leave their classrooms.

On Feb 11, in Soubre, students from several highschools protested against the interruption of public school following an ongoing professors' strike. They interrupted courses in Charles Bauza Donwahi private highschool, Modern 1 private highschool, Modern 2 private highschool and Bernard Zadi Zaourou private highschool, forcing the students to leave their classrooms.

11 February. The main entrance of the Vaal University of Technology (VUT) was blocked by protesting students over financial exclusion and the non-payment of allowances by the National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS). Students also protested at their residences over the shortage of accommodation. Stones and bottles were thrown by student to gain entrance to the residence. Police used rubber bullets to diffuse the riot.

assoc_actor_1: SASCO: South Africa Students Congress; Students (South Africa)
notes: 11 January. Students from University of South Africa protested in Langalibalele Street, Pietermaritzburg, burning tyres and refuse, over the National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) not paying allowances and tuition fees. The protest was led by the South African Students Congress (SASCO).

assoc_actor_1: EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command; Students (South Africa)
notes: 11 February. Students from Tshwane University of Technology, led by the EFFSC, protested at Ga-Rankuwa, Arcadia and at the campus in Pretoria West, demanding management to deal with National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) funding. They burnt tyres at the entrances of the campuses
University students in Idleb city protested for the second day the closure of the university by HTS after the public did not allow the latter to run it.

On Feb 11 2019, a demonstration was held in front of the Ministry of Education in Beirut as a result from the suicide of George Zureik earlier this month. Zureik lit himself on fire in protest against rising school fees in front of his daughter's school and he died of his wounds.

On February 11, students from Mission Blind School, Heikakpokpi, blocked the Imphal-Moreh highway by putting benches across it, at Heikakpokpi village (Chandel, Manipur). They claimed the school was not getting any assistance from the State Government.

On 11 Feb, GGM Science College students clashed with Kashmiri passengers stranded by road closures in Jammu city (J&K). The clash occurred after some Kashmiri passengers raised pro-Pakistan slogans over the administrations failure to airlift them to Srinagar. Police intervened with a lathicharge against the students.

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 11 Feb, in Chitradurga district (Karnataka), members of ABVP staged a protest demanding the Davanagere University administration to make necessary changes on certain issues in the Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) scheme.

On 11 Feb, commercial vehicle drivers took out a protest in the streets on Meewat district (Haryana) demanding the renewal of their licences. The government has demanded school certificates as requirement, resulting in the non-renewal of a number licences.

On February 11, students of Dibrugarh University staged a protest in Dibrugarh city (Dibrugarh, Assam), against the Citizenship Amendment Bill. They cut their fingers and wrote slogans on placards with their blood.

On 11 Feb, in Bhopal city (Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh), students of the Makhanlal Chaturvedi National University of Journalism and Mass Communication staged a protest against the irregularities in student evaluation. Students locked the gate to prevent the police from entering the campus. Some students had to jump from the gate to enter.

On 11 Feb, students staged a march from their accommodation in the Sainik colony area of Jammu city (J&K) to the CUJ campus in Bagla, Samba. The protest was held in response to the university's decision to cancel a bus service after students refused to pay a newly enacted monthly bus fare.

On 11 Feb, in Azad Maidan (Mumbai City, Maha), about 100 teachers from private-aided schools staged a protest condemning lack of subsidies to private-aided schools. Protest still ongoing as of 13 Feb. Day 1
On 11 Feb, in Chennai town (Chennai, TN), teaching fellows of the Anna University staged a protest near the main gate of the campus demanding regularisation of their service.

On 11 Feb, in Hyderabad (Hyderabad, Telangana), parents, including Mothers Association for Quality Education and Child Rights Protection Forum, staged a protest in front of the collectorate office demanding that the state government to establish an autonomous commission to monitor learning outcomes of school children.

On 11 Feb, in Rangareddy district (Telangana), parents, including Mothers Association for Quality Education and Child Rights Protection Forum, staged a protest in front of the collectorate office demanding that the state government to establish an autonomous commission to monitor learning outcomes of school children.

On 11 Feb, parents of students studying in Government Adarsh Senior Secondary School in Bathida city held a protest outside the school against the decision of changing the board from the Central Board of Secondary Education to the Punjab School Education Board.
On February 11, different organizations, students and teachers of different schools staged a protest in Golarchi town (Badin, Sindh), against shortage of water in Imam Wah.

On Feb. 11, 2019: Students from the Law Faculty in Tirana, who stayed barricaded in their university until this day, said they were ending their boycott, thus allowing the teaching process to take place. One of the students explained that the decision was taken because exams were approaching and they did not want to lose the academic year. Other students said the group will continue to seek education reform.

On Feb. 11 2019, students of the Technological Educational Institute of Western Macedonia in Kozani occupied the administration offices in protest to the possibility of merging with the University of Western Macedonia, which they believe would mean that all premises would have to be moved to the city of Grevena, where the University is based.
On Feb 10, in Beni Suef, in the Fourth neighborhood, a group of students from the Japanese school protested in front of the school against the rise of school fees.
University students in Idleb city protested the closure of the university by HTS after the public did not allow the latter to run it.

source: Ma'an News Agency; Palestinian News Network; Jordan News Agency
notes: On Feb 10 2019, a number of Palestinian students were injured when Israeli settlers under the protection of Israeli forces attacked Urif high school, forcing its students and staff to evacuate. Clashes erupted between students and Israeli soldiers and 10 students suffered from tear-gas inhalation.

On 10 Feb, in Belagavi (Belgaum, Karnataka), some Kannada organizations staged a protest march from Kannada Sahitya Sangha to the Deputy Commissioner's office to demand the withdrawal of the government decision that VTU will be bifurcated to create another technical university for South Karnataka.

On February 10, students of Gandaki Medical College protested by staging a relay hunger strike in Pokhara city (Kaski district, Gandaki), accusing the college of charging students more fees than recommended by the government.

On February 10, members of civil society staged a rally from Model School to Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh), against the killing of JST's Karachi chapter President Irshad Ahmed Ranjhani.

On Feb. 10, 2019: Hundreds of Albanians held a silent march in Tirana against sexual violence after a 13-year-old girl was sexually abused in a school in Kavaja by 8 students. Protesters held a banner "Rape is not a game" and marched towards the Police directorate.

On February 10, 2019 in Bar, Montenegro, approximately 1000 citizens protested against the construction of kindergarten in the backyard of a high school, which included felling of cypress trees that were over a hundred years old.
On 9 Feb, students staged a protest at the government degree college in Sunderbani town (Rajouri, J&K) against a lack of facilities at the college, including drinking water and hygienic toilets.
Around Feb 9th (exact date not reported) a primary school student was abducted and then killed by unknown people in Simiyu.

On Feb 9, environmental organization formed a human chain at Dhaka University (Shahbagh, Dhaka city), highlighting the adverse impacts of pollution and demanded immediate response from the government.
On 9 Feb, doctors at the Government Medical College in Amritsar city (Punjab) held a protest demanding installation of the CCTV cameras after two incidences of eve teasing on campus.

On February 9, students from Irilbung High School staged a protest and formed a human chain in front of their school, located in Kalika village (Imphal East, Manipur), to show support for the SSA and RMSA teachers on strike to press for several demands.

On February 9, students from Lamding Higher Secondary school staged a protest and formed a human chain in front of their school, located in Lamding village (Thoubal, Manipur), to show support for the SSA and RMSA teachers on strike to press for several demands.

On 9 Feb, in Vadodara city (Vadodara, Gujarat), the MS University's Faculty of Law students staged a protest against a professor who is the officer on special duty (OSD) and serving as in-charge dean of the faculty, condemning his/her incompetence and demanding a more efficient permanent dean. [size=massive]

On February 9, 2019, around 30 people took part in a protest in Lipetsk in opposition to the merger of the local school and lyceum which, the protesters allege, would hurt the quality of education. No incidents were reported.

assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Students (Burundi)

08 February. Students protested outside the Western Cape Nursing College in Klipfontein Road, Cape Town,. They were demanding increased safety on campus and running water.

On 8 February 2019, civil society representatives held a protest in Sidi Bouzid in support of the public prosecutor and judges of the Court of First Instance for the closure of the Koranic school in Regueb.

On 8 February, resident doctors staged a fourth day of protest at Government Medical College and Hospital in Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab) claiming a lack of action over an 'eve teasing' incident in which two female doctors were harassed by security guards. They demanded a CCTV network in the area to ensure security for doctors, as well as resignation of the Medical Superintendent. They are on indefinite strike.
On February 8, teachers from University of Karachi staged a protest in Gulshan town (Karachi, Sindh) against the VC alleging the VC of maladministration.
On February 8, residents of Khuda Bux Bhambhro village protested near Kotri town (Jamshoro, Sindh), demanding re-opening of a local school.

08 February. Protesting students held the audience of a comedy show 'hostage' at the University of KwaZulu-Natal in Glenwood, Durban, after demanding the closure of the theatre during student protests across the campus.

08 February. Protesting parents and the school governing body (SGB) have locked students and teachers out of the Matodzi High School, Vuwani, demanding the removal of the principal, who is described as unreliable and do not communicate with parents. [size=no report]
On 07 February, 2019, a group of students at the Annaba University staged a rally in protest of the murder of a Zimbabwean student.

assoc_actor_2: Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February. Students at the University of Kisangani, who rioted over the arrest of two students the day prior, continued to destroy property. The students attacked professor's homes and property. One woman was reportedly assaulted by the rioters.
07 February. Eastcape Midlands College in Uitenhage was shut down after students demanded accountability over 22 missing life orientation examination scripts.
On 7 February, anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired artillery at a school and farms in Al Mahjazah area of Sirwah district, west of Marib governorate. No casualties reported.
