notes: On Feb 7, leaders and activists of Chhatra Dal brought out a procession at Dhaka University campus (Shahbagh, Dhaka) after placing their seven-point demand regarding Ducsu polls to the vice chancellor.

On 7 February, resident doctors staged a third day of protest at Government Medical College and Hospital in Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab) claiming a lack of action over an 'eve teasing' incident in which two female doctors were harassed by security guards. They demanded a CCTV network in the area to ensure security for doctors, as well as resignation of the Medical Superintendent. They are on indefinite strike.

On February 7, villagers vandalized the Pakdi Middle School in Mahua Police Station area (Vaishali, Bihar), after sixteen minor students were beaten up by the school Principal for not sweeping the school floor.

On February 7, teachers from University of Karachi staged a protest in Gulshan town (Karachi, Sindh) against the VC alleging the VC of maladministration, and demanding issuance of advertisements of vacant posts and raise in PhD allowance.
On February 7, kidney patients and their attendants held a protest outside Chandka Medical College Hospital in Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh), against shortage of medicines.

7 February. Students from the Eastcape Midlands College in Makhanda (Grahamstown) have protested outside the campus over registration, transport, National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) funding, textbook, toilet facilities, computer and internet issues. The students burned rubbish at the gates of the college during the protest.

assoc_actor_1: ABVP: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad; Students (India)
notes: On 7 Feb, in Nagpur city (Nagpur, Maha), the ABVP activists and other students damaged properties inside the Nagpur University and also attacked security guards of the campus over non-admission of the ABVP to the school premises. The guards suffered minor injuries.

On February 7, the students of Gandaki Medical College protested by padlocking the college administration in Pokhara city (Kaski district, Gandaki), expressing dissatisfaction with the college authorities for charging high fees from the students.

On Feb. 7, 2019: Students from Shkoder's Univeristy (UHS) protested in Shkoder demanding education reform and presented their 10 demands, amongst which were 50% reduction in university tuition, new elections for student council, and daily operation of the heating system in their university.

On Feb. 7 2019, in Nicosia, thousands of Cypriot pupils with the support of teachers' organisations and trade unions protested holding banners and shouting slogans in front of the Ministry of Education against a proposed exam system. University students also participated demanding an increase of state student support.
07 February. PDP militias attacked a venue of an APC rally at Ikot Akpa Nkuk primary school and killed an event manager.
06 February. Ambazonian separatists burn a school and the vehicle of a principal in Babadjou of Bamboutos in the West.
06 February. University of Kisangani students demonstrated calling for the release of two students arrested in a murder case. The demonstrators burned school and teacher vehicles.
06 February. Protesters closed the entry and exit of Mqanduli, forcing hundreds of schools and clinics to shut down.
06 February. Students from William Hills Secondary School, in Actonville, embarked on a peaceful protest due to shortage of teachers since the beginning of the year.
06 February. Parents and school governing body members protested over teaching conditions at schools in Booysen Park.

06 February. About 300 students from the University of Johannesburg (UJ), Wits and Central Johannesburg College marched from UJ's Doornfontein to Auckland Park Kingsway (APK) campuses to protest registration, financial and accommodation issues. They clashed with security forces guarding the university, while police intervened to disperse the two groups, firing rubber bullets.

On Feb 6th, police and military forces prevented a demonstration from taking place at Makerere University. The demonstrators were objecting to the lack of lectures at the University (as part of the ongoing strike), and misleading statements from the University's management on the matter. A number of students were arrested, and some students burnt wood on the roads in the area. There are no further details at this time.
On February 6, a group of students protesting the visit of the president Erdogan to Middle East technical University in Ankara city were detained by the Police Forces prior to the visit.

On Feb 6, following sequel of clashes, rioting activists of BCL clashed at Chittagong University in Chittagong city to establish supremacy on campus. Both groups attacked each other with sharp weapons, brickbats and stones. No injuries were reported. Police fired tear gas shells to disperse the two groups.
On Feb 6, students of Jahangirnagar University (JU) demonstrated at campus in Savar, Dhaka, demanding election of the university's Central Students' Union Jucsu without any delay.

Defusal: On 6 February, a bomb was found by MGNREGA workers clearing sewage near the local government high school in Bhandal Bet village (Kapurthala, Punjab). Police instituted a security cordon and the school and surrounding area evacuated while the bomb is investigated and disposed of (the school is located near a river, so there seems to be little concern the bomb was deliberately planted).

On 6 February, resident doctors staged a second day of protest at Government Medical College and Hospital in Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab) claiming a lack of action over an 'eve teasing' incident in which two female doctors were harassed by security guards. They demanded a CCTV network in the area to ensure security for doctors, as well as resignation of the Medical Superintendent. They are on indefinite strike.

On 6 February, two young men were beaten by local residents for trying to rape a girl returning from school in Muzaffarnagar (Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh). Two other men escaped and are being hunted by police.

On February 6, Hindi teachers staged a sit-in protest at the gate of Hindi College, DM College Campus in Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur), against the Citizenship Amendment Bill. Local people also staged protest and blocked roads at several places of the city, under the Manipur People Against Citizenship Amendment Bill (MANPAC). The police disperse the protesters on a road by firing tear gas shells.
On 6 Feb, nursing students from the Kashmir University South Campus staged a protest at the Press Colony in Srinagar city (J&K), demanding university fee concessions.

On February 6, families of martyrs from the Assam Movement staged a march and returned the mementos conferred by the State government, in Tezpur city (Sonitpur, Assam), in protest against the Citizenship Amendment Bill. Teachers of seven colleges also staged a two-hour sit-in demonstration at Darrang College in the city.
On February 6, teachers from University of Karachi staged a protest in Gulshan town (Karachi, Sindh) against the VC alleging the VC of maladministration.
On 6 Feb, in Colombo city, a group of school principals staged a protest demanding that the government issue an amended Circular with regard to the efficiency of the Tamil Language.
06 February. Students from the University of Botswana protested at the university over the delayed welfare allowance payments.
06 February. Students at the Temple Valley Secondary School, Verulam, protested to demand the resignation of the principal. Stones were thrown at the buildings and refuse bins were burned.
06 February. Pupils held a peaceful protest during assembly at Sans Souci Girls' High School in Cape Town.

notes: 05 February. A Durban University of Technology student was shot and killed by police at the Steve Biko Campus during an EFFSC protest. Police claimed the students became unruly and hurled stones at staff members , while students denied.

05 February. Students led by Wits Student Representative Council started a hunger strike and held a small demonstration to protest registration, financial and accommodation issues at at Wits University in Johannesburg. This led to a scuffle with a private security guard, one injured.

On February 5th, several demonstrations occurred in Khartoum, involving students, lawyers, professors and doctors. Police used tear gas and batons to disperse students close to the University of Khartoum.

On 5 February 2019, the owners of individual and collective taxis, rural transport vehicles and driving schools held a strike and a protest in front of the transport station in Tozeur against the unresponsiveness of the regional transport administration to solve the problems of the sector.

Students of the Faculty of Medicine and the faculty of Engineering at Hadramout University of Fawwah area near Mukalla demonstrated on the 4th and 5th of Feb., 2019, demanding that they be recognized as employees of the University in order to fulfill experience requirements. [size=no report]
On Feb 5, four activists were injured when rioting factions of BCL clashed at Chattogram College in Chittagong city over establishing supremacy at campus.

On 5 February, contractual nurses at various state hospitals, under the Punjab Contractual Nursing and Ancillary Staff Association, staged a protest against CM Amarinder Singh in Patiala (Patiala, Punjab). They marched from Government Medical College to YPS roundabout, before being stopped on their way to the CM's residence by police, though they eventually reached it later in the day and staged a dharna for several hours. They were demanding regularisation.

On 5 February, resident doctors staged a protest at Government Medical College and Hospital in Amritsar (Amritsar, Punjab) claiming a lack of action over an 'eve teasing' incident in which two female doctors were harassed by security guards. On 5 February, students at Jawaharlal Nehru University in Mehrauli area of S. Delhi (Delhi) staged a protest after a professor who is accused of sexual assault by 9 students came on campus and accessed one of the laboratories, which they claim is in violation of a High Court order.

On 5 Feb, students staged a protest at the Central University of Jammu in Jammu city (J&K) against a bus fare hike implemented by the university administration.
On 5 Feb, in Chennai town (Chennai, TN), teaching fellows of the Anna University staged a protest on the campus demanding regularisation of their service.

On February 5, the students of Gandaki Medical College protested by padlocking the out patient department in Pokhara city (Kaski district, Gandaki), expressing dissatisfaction with the college authorities for charging high fees from the students.

Between 4 December 2018 and 31 March 2019, it has been reported that over 37,000 people, and primarily Papuans, have been displaced from 10 districts in Nduga Regency, Papua province, and have taken refuge in caves and forests near their villages. Between 4 December 2018 and 31 March 2019, it has been reported that over 37,000 people, and primarily Papuans, have been displaced from 10 districts in Nduga Regency, Papua province, and have taken refuge in caves and forests near their villages. This is due to ongoing clashes between the army and separatist guerilla forces. Of the 16 schools in Nduga, 15 have now been closed. This has been accompanied by residents alleging that the military has killed at least 25 people, including 2 students, who were not connected separatist rebels. The dataset has previously coded the deaths of 11, 14 deaths are being associated with this event.

notes: On January 10, several students were arrested by the police in Dighalipukhuri area in Guwahati city (Kamrup Metropolitan, Assam), while they were protesting against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, 2016. Students of the Guwahati University also sat on a 10-hour hunger strike in protest against the Bill. Protesters of Krishak Mukti Sangram Samiti (KMSS), Asom Jatiyatabadi Yuba Chatra Parishad (AJYCP) and other organisations also staged a protest and were detained.

On 10 January, staff of Hindu College at Delhi University (Timarpur, Delhi) staged a protest after 2/3 of staff residence on campus was torn down to make way for a private research centre, and that they had to move to temporary quarters.

assoc_actor_1: SFI: Students Federation of India; Students (India)
notes: On January 10, in Ongole town (Prakasam, AP), members of SFI staged a protest demanding that the government intervene immediately and see the Acharya Nagarjuna University conducts a mega supplementary to the degree students and offer concessions in exam fees and bus passes.

On January 10, students of All Assam Students' Union (AASU) and the Doomdooma College Students' Union observed Black Day and staged a protest in Doom Dooma city (Tinsukia, Assam), against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill 2016. They burnt the copy of the Bill and the effigies of the Prime Minister, Home Minister and Chief Minister.

Assumed on January 10, in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Telangana), students and faculty members of the University of Hyderabad staged a protest against the removal of the tent that had become a stage for protests after the suicide of a UoH scholar.
On January 10, students of Dimoria College gathered at the college gate in the city (Kamrup Metropolitan, Assam), to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, 2016.

On January 10, resident doctors of Tribhuvan University Teaching Hospital picketed the hospital and halted all services, except emergency services, at Maharajgunj locality in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district, Bagmati), demanding payment of their salary, which had been due since the past eight month.
On January 10, school van owners and drivers held a protest in Saddar town (Karachi, Sindh), against the police order to remove CNG cylinders from school vans.

actor2: Military Forces of Thailand (2014-) Volunteer Defense Corps
notes: On 10 Jan 2019, in tambon Prachan (Yarang, Pattani) about eight armed men dressed like soldiers (suspected separatists) opened fire on defence volunteers at Bukoh school. Four defence volunteers were killed.

On January 10, hundreds of doctors staged a protest rally at the Patliputra Medical College Hospital (PMCH) in Dhanbad city (Dhanbad, Jharkhand), demanding implementation of the Medical Protection Act (MPA) bill. The act aims to protect health workers from violence by family members of patients.

On January 10, hundreds of doctors staged a demonstration at the Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Medical College Hospital (MGMMCH) in Jamshedpur city (East Singhbum, Jharkhand), demanding implementation of the Medical Protection Act (MPA) bill. The act aims to protect health workers from violence by family members of patients.

On January 10, students from Nalbari College, MNC Balika Mahavidyalaya and Barbhag College staged a dharna in their respective schools in Nalbari district (Assam), against the Citizenship Amendment Bil, 2016. They burnt effigies of the Chief Minister. They also boycotted classes.

On January 10, hundreds of doctors staged demonstrations at all three medical colleges of the state and in all 24 district civil surgeon (CS) offices of Jharkhand state, demanding implementation of the Medical Protection Act (MPA) bill. The act aims to protect health workers from violence by family members of patients.

On January 10, students of Government Primary School in Dilmurad Chachar staged a sit-in as a protest in Kandhkot town (assumed based on city line) (Kashmore, Sindh), against the rundown condition of their school, lack of lady teachers and unavailability of basic facilities.

assoc_actor_1: SLECG: Free Union of Teachers and Researchers of Guinea; Labour Group (Guinea)
notes: 10 January. SLECG and government negotiations fail over salary discussions, leading to riots in Labe with stones thrown at schools and other students. Police intervene to disperse the rioters.

On 10 January 2019, a number of unemployed high school graduates staged a protest in front of the headquarters of the municipality in Bir Ali Ben Khalifa where protesters have been holding a sit-in since a week ago to demand employment and development for the city and its people.
On January 10, college students staged a protest in the middle of the road in Jorhat city (Jorhat, Assam), against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill, 2016.
On January 10, students of Tinsukia Women's College and Tinsukia Commerce College took out a protest rally in the city (Tinsukia, Assam), against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill 2016.
On 9 January, parents of learners from a 50-year-old small church school in Herold near George in the Southern Cape have protested and vowed to do everything to prevent it from closing down.

On 9 January 2019, several cities in Tunisia, including Gromblia, Soliman, Sfax, Metlaoui, witnessed demonstrations led by students, sometimes accompanied by their parents, to denounce the irresponsible actions of Lasaad Yaakoubi, Secretary General of the Teachers Union, in causing them to lose their school year.

On 9 January 2019, several cities in Tunisia, including Gromblia, Soliman, Sfax, Metlaoui, witnessed demonstrations led by students, sometimes accompanied by their parents, to denounce the irresponsible actions of Lasaad Yaakoubi, Secretary General of the Teachers Union, in causing them to lose their school year.

On 9 January 2019, several cities in Tunisia, including Gromblia, Soliman, Sfax, Metlaoui, witnessed demonstrations led by students, sometimes accompanied by their parents, to denounce the irresponsible actions of Lasaad Yaakoubi, Secretary General of the Teachers Union, in causing them to lose their school year.

On 9 January 2019, students and their parents staged a protest in front of the secondary school of Majida Boulila in Sfax to express their anger and refusal to attend school and receive education without taking the exams.
On 9 January 2019, secondary school teachers in Sidi Bouzid staged a protest in the city to demand their rights as pat of the "National Day of Anger."

On 9 January 2019, dozens of high school teachers gathered in front of the headquarters of the Tunisian General Labor Union (UGTT) and organized a march to Habib Bourguiba Avenue to observe a sit-in in front of the municipal theater. The teachers called for the satisfaction of a set of demands including an increase in wages and the improvement of working conditions.
On January 9, students staged a protest in Dibrugarh University in the city (Dibrugarh, Assam), against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill 2016.

On January 9, members of the student fraternity of Cotton University began an indefinite hunger strike in front of the main gate of the university in Guwahati city (Kamrup Metropolitan, Assam), in protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill 2016. The Students' Federation of India (SFI) State committee also organised a protest march in the city.
On January 9, in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Telangana), students of Osmania University staged a protest demanding regular water supply.

On January 9, in Bhopal town (Bhopal, MP), franchise center workers staged a protest and demanded that the Makhanlal Chaturvedi National University scrap online tests and restart examinations in the previous manner and terminate the contract of company that is holding examination for the DCA courses.
On January 9, students of Government Commerce College protested in Ahmedpur East town (Bahawalpur, Punjab), demanding basic amenities in their hostels.

On January 9, under the banner of Private Medical Students Union Pakistan, students of private medical college staged a protest near the Islamia University's Old Abbasia campus in Bahawalpur city (Bahawalpur, Punjab), against allegedly unilateral increase in tuition fees in the province.
On January 9, unidentified people threw rocks at a college van and shattered the windows injuring some students inside the van, in Kasur town (Kasur, Punjab).
On January 9, students protested in Kasur town (Kasur, Punjab), against unidentified people that vandalized their college van and injured some students.

On January 9, Muttahida Talba Mahaz, a student organization, organized a protest by students of Postgraduate College Mardan in Mardan town (Mardan, KP), against the Abdul Wali Khan University administration for not handing over a building to their college.

On January 9, employees and students at the Faculty of energy and mining engineering at the Sebha University organized a protest in front of university headquarters to condemn repeated intrusions and demand improved security.
On 9 January, t Chumani Primary School in Reeston, East London parents picketed outside and demanded keys to the office that contain the school's resources.
On 9 January, the first day of the school year at Cape Town's Bergville Primary School in Bishop Lavis kicked off with a picket to highlight complaints over teacher shortages and poor safety.
On 9 January, a group of protesters disrupted three schools in Malmesbury. Protesters demanded that the Western Cape Education Department (WCED) expand and upgrade Naphakade Primary School.

On 9 January 2019, classes were suspended in several colleges and high schools in Gafsa. The students held protest marches throughout the city calling for solutions to the dispute between the Ministry of Education and the General Federation of Secondary Education and the boycott of exams by teachers.

On 9 January 2019, the owners of driving schools in Tataouine held a protest in front of the headquarters of the Technical Agency for Land Transportation calling for the resolution of the professional problems between them and the regional director of the technical agency in Tataouine.

On Jan. 9, 2019: Albanian students barricaded themselves at the Polytechnic University in Tirana and demonstrated, demanding education reform. While some students tried to move chairs and tables out of the university, they clashed with university guards. No injuries were reported.

assoc_actor_1: CITU: Centre of Indian Trade Unions; AITUC: All India Trade Union Congress; Labour Group (India); AIUTUC: All India United Trade Union Centre; INTUC: Indian National Trade Union Congress; CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist)
notes: On 8 January, a group of around 10 labour activists stopped a school bus and attacked the bus driver by Champadali crossing in Barasat area of Delhi (Delhi) for not following the national two day labour strike against BJP policies. The man was rescued by nearby civilians. The strike was called by several groups including the CITU, INTUC, AITUC, HMS, AITUC and CPI-M.
On 8 January, retired teachers from Kendriya Vidyalaya Schools staged a protest rally and dharna in Jalandhar (Jalandhar, Punjab) in support for their demands for two years arrears pay.

On 8 January, around a hundred people staged a protest at the Delhi University gates in Timarpur (Delhi) to demand permanent hiring of the adhoc faculty employed by the university, who are on indefinite hunger strike there.

On January 8, in Jaipur city (Jaipur, Rajasthan), hundreds of Rajasthan Administrative Services (RAS) candidates of Rajasthan University (RU) staged a protest against corruption in the recruitment process for RAS candidates.

On January 8, in Mysuru town (Mysuru, Karnataka), students of Karnataka State Open University (KSOU) staged a protest stating that the university postponed the common entrance test without informing the exam dates.

On January 8, in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Telangana), leaders from various BC students' associations at the Central government at Arts College staged a demonstration against quotas for upper castes.

On January 8, students and teachers of Khairpur Medical College staged a protest rally culminating at Khairpur Press Club in Khairpur city (Khairpur, Sindh), demanding affiliation with Pakistan Medical and Dental Council.

On January 8, employees of Ghulam Mohammad Mahar Medical College Sukkur held protest and a token strike in Sukkur city (Sukkur, Sindh), demanding regularization of services for daily-wage earners and contractual employees.

On 8 Jan, in Batticaloa area, residents staged a protest at the Valuvankerni Vivekananda Maha Vidyalayam to denounce two Muslim teachers who allegedly influenced a Hindu school girl to convert to Islam and to demand answers to the school girl who is currently missing.

On 8 Jan 2019, in Ban Pong Sakhor in tambon Moh Mawee (Yarang, Pattani), a bomb detonated in front of a local non-formal education center. It is suspected that it was planted by Southern Muslim Separatists. A private and a 12-year-old schoolgirl were injured.

On 8 January, chaos erupted at the University of South Africa (Unisa) Pietermaritzburg campus as protesting students blocked off a street by burning tyres, calling on management to address their demands.

assoc_actor_1: CITU: Centre of Indian Trade Unions; AITUC: All India Trade Union Congress; Labour Group (India); AIUTUC: All India United Trade Union Centre; INTUC: Indian National Trade Union Congress; CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist)
source: Telegraph (India); Afternoon Voice (India); Indo-Asian News Service
notes: On January 8, a school bus was stone pelted in Champadali area of Barasat city (North 24 Parganas, West Bengal), during the two day nationwide strike called by the central unions, including the CITU, INTUC, AITUC, HMS, AITUC and CPI-M, against the BJP-government policies. There was also a clash with the police in the railway station, and clashes with TMC supporters.
07 January. Students protest in Congo Town of Monrovia against the construction of a wall blocking the entrance to their school and church facilities.
On 7 January 2019, the teachers of the Ibn Battuta School in El Kbab protested in front of the the administration building against the sale of the school's coal by the school director.

On 7 Jan 2019, a military court sentenced two Al Shabaab militants to death after finding them guilty of killing a male clan elder who was an electoral delegate in 2016. The two AS militants were executed at the police school public square at Hamar Weyne district, Mogadishu.

actor2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: On January 7th, demonstrations - led by secondary school students - occurred once more in Atbara (River Nile state). As the demonstrators marched, police "confronted" demonstrators with batons and tear gas.
On 7 January 2019, teachers of a secondary school in Rogba in Tataouine governorate staged a protest against the poor quality of the toilets.

Around 7 January, farmers locked up around 50 cows in the local public school in Anantpur Dhaukal village (Kanpur Dehat, Uttar Pradesh). This is a recurring protest throughout the state over the number of stray cattle left loose in the area.

On 7 January, teachers at Government Khalsa Senior Secondary School in Bathinda (Bathinda, Punjab) staged a protest at Oriental Bank of Commerce branch in Kikar Bazaar for reportedly not receiving their salaries for 10 months. The bank has apparently blocked the salaries over a dispute between teachers and school management, though the reason is unclear.

On 7 January, the Parents Rights Association staged a protest and burnt an effigy of the state education minister in Bathinda (Bathinda, Punjab) over a statement he made comparing public schools to dhabas and private schools to 5 star hotels.

On 7 January, the Parents Association staged a protest and burnt an effigy of the state Education minister at Bharat Nagar Chowk in Ludhiana (Ludhiana, Punjab) after he made a controversial comment comparing state schools to dhabas and private schools to hotels.
On 7 January, residents staged a protest at Malout (Muktsar, Punjab) against the installation of a cell phone tower near Shekhu Road there, next to a school.

assoc_actor_1: Students (Sri Lanka); IUSF: Inter University Students' Federation
notes: On 7 Jan, in Colombo city, the Rajarata University students and the IUSF staged a Satyagraha sit-in protest opposite the University Grants Commission over several demands, among them, to stop any curtailing of the number of students enrolled for several universities.

Public school teachers held a rally in support of the Alliance of Concerned Teachers, which is supposedly being investigated by the police, at the Department of Education's office in Manila, Metro Manila on January 7, 2019.
On 7 January 2019, the parents of students at one of the schools in Ain Dharam blocked the national road No. 17 in protest against the the lack of school transportation.
On Jan. 7, 2019: Students from the Fan Noli university in Korce boycotted their classes and protested outside the university demanding the government to fulfil their 8 demands for educational reform.

On 6 Jan 2019, dozens of parents blocked the road leading to Benaddellah district near Ahmed Cheddani primary school (3 km from downtown Bouira), denouncing the lack of consistency and lack of quality of education provided by the school.
On 6 January, Mvuzo High School in France township in Pietermaritzburg were damaged in suspected arson attacks.

In addition to various post-demonstration arrests, 20 professors from the University of Khartoum and 3 journalists were arrested in Khartoum (coordinates used) on Jan 6th; an MP with the PCP was reportedly detained on Jan 9th, after she participated in a demonstration in Omdurman. Elewhere, an activist was rearrested in El Gedaref on January 8th, prompting a social media campaign calling for his release, whilst a nurse (who is also an activist) was arrested in El Obeid on Jan 9th.

On January 6, two groups of students clashed in Garamur area in Jorhat city (Jorhat, Assam), when a group of boys from an adjacent village started to play cricket inside the Jorhat Engineering College campus. Two persons were injured.

On 6 January, farmers locked up around stray cows in the local public school in Bhadiwar village of Shanakargarh (Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh). This is a recurring protest throughout the state over the number of stray cattle left loose in the area.
On 6 January, Bathembu High School in uMzinyathi district in Msinga, northern KZN, were damaged in suspected arson attacks.

On Sunday, January 6, 2019, an unspecified number of people took part in coordinated one-person protests in front of the building of the Saint Petersburg city administration in opposition of the planned closure of the facility of secondary vocational education at ITMO University. No incidents were reported.
Anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired machine guns in the direction of the Hudaydah airport, Al Shabaab park, and College of Medicine. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
On January 5, locals protested in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory), against the anti-encroachment operation launched to recover occupied land of Quaid-i-Azam University.
On 5 January 2019, with the presence of the Minister of Higher Education in Monastir, a number of university professors staged a protest to demand the reform of the public higher education system.
Anti-Houthi forces reportedly fired machine guns in the direction of the Hudaydah airport and College of Medicine. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
01 May. Students of the Federal University of Technology in Akure protested the death of a fellow student who was knocked down on the nearby highway. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2019, some parents residing in Borj Al Aifa continued and escalated their protest by placing barricades and burning tires on road No. 5 in an attempt to put pressure on the authorities not to close a school in the area.
On January 4, a school teacher was beaten up by the locals after he was caught with a married woman in her house, in No.1 Bhelkara village in Hajo city area (Kamrup, Assam).

actor1: NSUI: National Students Union of India

No details of the original clash recorded.
On 4 Jan, locals and school students staged a protest at Battal village (Udhampur, J&K) against industrial pollution in the area.

On January 4, students of SM College demonstrated by pelting stones at the college building in Saddar town (Karachi, Sindh) against the college administration for not issuing admit card for their annual exams.

Around 4 January, police and farmers clashed after farmers locked a group of stray cattle up in a school in Bidhnu area of Kanpur (Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh), leaving 3 officers injured. No further details.

actor1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
notes: Defusal: On January 4, Bomb Disposal Squad defused an IED planted near a private school in Bannu town (Bannu, KP).
04 October. Residents of Setlagole outside Mahikeng in the North West gathered at the court, demanding the prosecution of older men who are impregnating young school girls. [size=no report].
On Jan 3, Israeli soldiers opened live fire and fired tear gas at Palestinian students who were leaving their school in Tell near Nablus. The reason for the attack on the students is unknown.

On 3 January, members of the Academic Council at Delhi University (Timarpur, Delhi) staged a protest and blocked the VC's office on campus there demanding the implementation of the University Grants Commission regulations from 2018.

On January 3, parents and locals staged a protest in front of a school in Demow city (Sivasagar, Assam), alleging the headmaster was drunk while working. There were also reports of irregularities in mid-day meal, free textbook distribution and uniforms.

On 3 January, around 35 Congress members staged a protest outside Lovely Professional University in Phagwara town (Kapurthala, Punjab) during a visit there by PM Modi. They protested over the Rafale deal and other issues, before being detained by police for several hours.
On 3 Jan, in Colombo city, students of the Rajarata University staged a protest outside the Fort Railway Station to demand the reopening of their university.
On 3 January, ad hoc teachers began an indefinite protest and hunger strike on Delhi University's North Campus in Timarpur (Delhi) demanding regularisation.
On Jan 3, Police Forces of Angola have stopped a demonstration performed by the Movement of Angolan Students, protesting against university access fees.
On 3 January 2019, some parents residing in Borj El Aifa blocked road No. 5 connecting Kef to Tunis in protest against a ministerial decision to close a school in the area.
03 January. Two men cut the throat of a university student, as they suspected his father of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.

On 2 January 2019, in Amarapura Township, in Mandalay Region, four students staged a protest demanding that Yandarpon University increase security on the university campus after a student was murdered. The students were later arrested.
02 January: Dembi Dolo University president, Dr. Delasa Bulcha was kidnapped by unidentified armed group near Addis Ababa.
On 2 January 2019, some parents blocked road number 5 connecting El Kef to Tunis in protest against the decision of the Ministry of Education to close the doors of a school in Borj El Aifa.

On Jan 2, Israeli forces raided a Palestinian school in the West Bank town of Tuqu near Bethlehem. Israeli soldiers fired rubber bullets, teargas and stun grenades during the raid on the school resulting in the temporary asphyxiation of some students from teargas. The reason for the raid remains unknown.
On 2/1/2019, a group of students at Tarbiat Modares University in Tehran staged a rally in solidarity with the families of students of Azad University who were killed in a bus crash.

On Jan 02, the human rights office in al Muthanna province carried out a protest with the participation of tens of school students and kindergartners demanding the amendment of the curricula and the enactment of child care laws in Celebration Square in Samawah city.
On Jan 2, Hebrew University students protested against a lecturer's reprimand of a student, an active duty soldier, for wearing her IDF uniform to class. The teacher later apologized publicly.
On Jan 2, Jubo League men beat up a BNP activist and teacher (Shafiqul Islam) at Tanore Kolma High School and vandalised his motorcycle in Tanore (Rajshahi).
Assumed on January 2, in Bhilai town (Durg, Chhattisgarh), students of Bhilai Nair Samajam (BNS) staged a protest against the Kerala government over Sabarimala issue at BNS School premises.

On January 2, Quaid-i-Azam University Alumni Association (QAUAA), Academic Staff Association(ASA), employees, students and representatives of civil society staged a protest outside the National Press Club in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory) demanding removal of illegal occupation from the univeristy's land.
Week of 02 January. A school principal in Bamenyam of Galim district is kidnapped by Ambazonian separatists. He was released hours later.

On 1 January, residents of the area began an indefinite protest dharna against the new regional centre of the Maharana Pratap University of Horticulture Science near Raiya village (Jhajjar, Haryana). The locals say that have not been adequately compensated for their land.

On January 1, in Kozhikode town (Kozhikode, Kerala), Congress activists staged a protest march to the office of the Deputy Director of Education (DDE) in protest against the half-day off declared for schools that they asserted was for mobilizing people for the government-backed women's wall. Congress workers had a minor clash with the police outside the DDE office when they tried to barge into the officials' cabin.

As reported on January 1, assistant professors and associate professors of the Peoples Medical University protested by raising slogans and setting up a hunger strike camp in Nawabshah city (Shaheed Benazirabad, Sindh) demanding transfers to another ward within the hospital.
On January 1, unidentified armed men shot dead a watchman of a government school in Janikhel town (Bannu, KP).
